etymology.description: 彳(彳) (chì, "step") + 聿(聿) (yù, "brush") + 肅(肅) (sù, phonetic component) = ceremonious behavior -> solemn
etymology.interpretation: The character 肅(肅) (sù, "solemn") combines 彳(彳) (chì, "step"), suggesting movement or action, and the phonetic 聿(聿) (yù, "brush"), associated with writing or noble pursuits, to convey a sense of formal, solemn demeanor.

examples.chinese: 他在纪念碑前保持着肅静(他在紀念碑前保持著肅靜)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài jìniànbēi qián bǎochí zhe sùjìng.
examples.english: He maintained a solemn silence in front of the monument.

examples.chinese: 军人肃立(軍人肅立)，目光专注(目光專注)。
examples.english: The soldiers stood solemnly, their gazes focused.

examples.chinese: 仪式庄严(儀式莊嚴)，气氛肅穆(氣氛肅穆)。
examples.english: The ceremony was solemn, and the atmosphere was dignified.
